translated: Since these do not exist, one is said to attain happiness, attain fearlessness, attain fearlessness, and attain relief.üîΩHere, there is no anxiety due to suffering because there is no sorrow, lamentation, suffering,

original: dang / yid mi bde ba med pas sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: dang / yid mi bde ba med pas sdug bsngal gyis bag tsha ba med do //
translated: and mental unhappiness.

original: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan song dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / chad pa dang / mya ngan dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: bdag gis smad pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa dang / ngan song dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / chad pa dang / mya ngan dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas 'jigs pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: There is no anxiety due to fear because there is no fear of self-condemnation, fear of condemnation by others, fear of miserable realms, fear of lack of livelihood, fear of punishment, fear of sorrow, and fear of death.

original: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag gis ma gos pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dag gis ma gos pas 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bag tsha ba med do //
translated: There is no anxiety due to the worldly dharmas because one is not defiled by gain and loss, fame and obscurity, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pas mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / the tshom gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa rnam pa med pas mi shes pa'i bag tsha ba med do //
translated: He is free from the anxiety of ignorance, doubt, and wrong knowledge.

original: de bas na bag tsha ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bag tsha ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir cang shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the ‚Äúknower of the right and wrong paths‚Äù because he is free from anxiety.

original: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po ste /
analyzed: glang po chen po zhes bya ba ni gtso bo chen po ste /
translated: He is called the ‚Äúgreat elephant‚Äù because he is the great leader.

original: kha cig ni gsum rig pa dang / kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni gsum rig pa dang / kha cig ni so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: Some have attained the three knowledges, some have attained the analytical knowledges,

original: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug pa thob pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni mngon par shes pa drug pa thob pa /
translated: some have attained the six superknowledges,

original: kha cig ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa /
analyzed: kha cig ni kun shes pa brda sprod pa /
translated: some are teachers of all knowledge,

original: kha cig ni gcig pur gnas pa thob pa ste /üîΩmthar thug pa thub pa'i chos rnyed pa'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gcig pur gnas pa thob pa ste / mthar thug pa thub pa'i chos rnyed pa'i phyir glang po chen po'o //
translated: some have attained the state of solitude.

original: bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa /
translated: He is called the ‚Äúgreat elephant‚Äù because he has attained the ultimate Dharma of the Sage.üîΩHe is called the ‚Äúone who has done his duty‚Äù

original: byed pa byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa byas pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad kyi sgrub pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: because he has completed the practice of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar ba ni bya ba ste nges par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yongs su rdzogs pas sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par thar ba ni bya ba ste nges par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the function is the complete perfection of morality, meditative concentration, and wisdom, because one is definitely liberated from all suffering.

original: 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mig gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa ni byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung bas 'tsho ba dang / chog shes pas 'tsho ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi mig gis 'tsho ba dang / yang dag par mgu bar byed pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa ni byed pa ste /
translated: The performance is the livelihood of one who has few desires, the livelihood of one who is content, the livelihood of one who has the eye of the ascetic practices, the livelihood of one who is satisfied with what he has, and so on.

original: rang dgar spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dgar spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these are the conduct of one who is independent.

original: de gnyi ga yongs su rdzogs pa ni bya ba byas pa dang byed pa byas pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yongs su rdzogs pa ni bya ba byas pa dang byed pa byas pa'o //
translated: The completion of both the function and the performance is the performance of duty and the performance of action.

original: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la khur ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: khur bor ba zhes bya ba la khur ni bzhi ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving laid down the burden‚Äù means that there are four burdens:

original: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bca' ba'i khur dang / brtson pa'i khur ro //
analyzed: phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / dam bca' ba'i khur dang / brtson pa'i khur ro //
translated: the burden of the aggregates, the burden of the afflictions, the burden of vows, and the burden of striving.

original: yongs su dor ba'i phyir dang / rab tu @7b spang ba'i phyir dang / mthar phyin dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su dor ba'i phyir dang / rab tu @7b spang ba'i phyir dang / mthar phyin dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: because of the complete relinquishment of the burden, because of the complete abandonment of the burden, because of the completion of the burden, and because of the complete fulfillment of the burden.

original: de dag go rims bzhin du bor ba ste /
analyzed: de dag go rims bzhin du bor ba ste /
translated: They are respectively:

original: yongs su dor ba dang / spangs pa dang / mthar phyin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dor ba dang / spangs pa dang / mthar phyin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the relinquishment of the burden, the abandonment of the burden, the completion of the burden, and the complete fulfillment of the burden.

original: de yang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung pa spangs pa dang / lam bsgoms pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung pa spangs pa dang / lam bsgoms pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pas so //
translated: Moreover, it is through the complete understanding of suffering, the abandonment of the origin, the cultivation of the path, and the realization of cessation.

original: de bor bas phung po med pa'i bde ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bor bas phung po med pa'i bde ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba thob pa'o //
translated: By relinquishing that, one attains the bliss of the absence of the burden, the bliss of complete liberation, the bliss of perfect enlightenment, and the bliss of complete peace.

original: de bas na khur bor ba nyid kyis khur por ba'i bde ba thob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na khur bor ba nyid kyis khur por ba'i bde ba thob pa'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: Therefore, by the very relinquishment of the burden, the quality of attaining the bliss of the one who has put down the burden is shown.

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi don thob pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi don thob pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attainment of one's own goal refers to the attainment of one's own goal in two ways:

original: gnod pa spangs pa dang / don thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa spangs pa dang / don thob pa'o //
translated: The elimination of harm and the attainment of the goal.

original: de la dang po ni ma rig pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni ma rig pa spangs pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //

original: gang yang rig pa bskyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rig pa bskyod pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ste /
translated: The second is the attainment of nirvana through the elimination of the obscurations to that which is to be known.üîΩThe third is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental afflictions.üîΩThe fourth is the elimination of the obscurations to the mental body.üîΩThe fifth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe sixth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe seventh is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe eighth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe ninth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe tenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe eleventh is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The twelfth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe thirteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe fourteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe fifteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe sixteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe seventeenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe eighteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni srid par kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
analyzed: srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba ni srid par kun tu sbyor ba ni dgu ste /
translated: The nineteenth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twentieth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-first is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-second is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-third is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-fourth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-fifth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-sixth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: skyes bu srid par sbyor bar byed pa dang / srid par 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang /
analyzed: skyes bu srid par sbyor bar byed pa dang / srid par 'ching bar byed pa'i phyir lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang /
translated: The twenty-seventh is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: The twenty-eighth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.üîΩThe twenty-ninth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: lta ba la sogs pa yang yin kun tu sbyor ba yang yin pas lta ba la sogs pa kun tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa yang yin kun tu sbyor ba yang yin pas lta ba la sogs pa kun tu sbyor ro //
translated: The thirtieth is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body.

original: 'di dag yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de ni de skad du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de ni de skad du brjod do //
translated: The thirty-first is the elimination of the obscurations of the mental body

original: yongs su zad pa ni rab tu nyams pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad pa ni rab tu nyams pa'o //
translated: Complete exhaustion is complete destruction.

original: de las dang po gsum ni zag pa med pa'i yang dag par lta bas zad pa'o //
analyzed: de las dang po gsum ni zag pa med pa'i yang dag par lta bas zad pa'o //
translated: The first three are exhausted by uncontaminated right view.

original: bar ma gsum dang dgu pa'i phyogs gcig 'dod pa'i khams kyi phyogs ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas zad pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma gsum dang dgu pa'i phyogs gcig 'dod pa'i khams kyi phyogs ni zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas zad pa'o //
translated: The three middling and one part of the ninth are exhausted by the uncontaminated meditative attainment of the desire realm.

original: lhag ma gsum ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyis zad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyis zad pa'o //
translated: The remaining three are exhausted by the knowledge of the path of the arhat.üîΩThe mind is completely liberated by right knowledge. Right knowledge is right view. The mind is completely liberated by that.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa des sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba la yang dag pa'i shes pa ni yang dag pa'i rtog pa des sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Right belief is right thought.

original: yang dag par mos pa ste gang du mos she na dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / theg pa gsum dang ldan @8a * //
analyzed: yang dag par mos pa ste gang du mos she na dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang / theg pa gsum dang ldan @8a * //
translated: What does one believe? The qualities of the Three Jewels, the teachings of the Three Vehicles,

original: pa ston pa dag dang / bden pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: pa ston pa dag dang / bden pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la'o //
translated: the Four Noble Truths, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sems gang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang sgyur ba de ni sems kyi dbang ste /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang thams cad kyi dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa thob pa zhes bya ba la sems gang gi ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang sgyur ba de ni sems kyi dbang ste /

original: thams cad kyang yin la de yang yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang yin la de yang yin no //

original: de dag la dam pa'i pha rol ni mtha'o //üîΩphyin pa ni 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la dam pa'i pha rol ni mtha'o // phyin pa ni 'gro ba ste /

analyzed: ae ma zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ji ltar thob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar thob pa yin zhe na /

original: gang du 'dod pa dang / gang gi tshe 'dod pa dang / ji srid 'dod pa dang / lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs las bzlog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la snyoms par 'jug pa dang /

analyzed: gnas pa dang / ldang ba dang / 'gogs pa la dbang ba'i phyir ro //

translated: The word all in the above verse refers to the disciples of the Buddha. But is it true that even Ananda had such qualities?üîΩThe verse says, except for one person.

original: gcig ma gtogs pa zhes brjod mod ce na /
analyzed: gcig ma gtogs pa zhes brjod mod ce na /
translated: If it is said that except for one person is meant,

original: gang zag smos pa ni dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag smos pa ni dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad las gang yang rung ba cig yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: phyir bstan pa la khyad par du bstan pa'i don ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad gnyis so //
analyzed: phyir bstan pa la khyad par du bstan pa'i don ni 'di lta ste zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad gnyis so //

translated: From here on is the teaching of the ≈õrƒÅvaka sa·πÖgha.

analyzed: de bas byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun 'dir mdor bsdus pa'i dbang du byas pa yin pa'i phyir ma smos pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva sa·πÖgha is not mentioned here, because it is included in this summary.

analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod kyis sems can dpag tu med pa yang dag par tshim par byed pa dang mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies innumerable sentient beings with the enjoyment of material things and is inexhaustible.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa rin po che'i 'byung gnas te /

analyzed: de dang 'dra bar yon tan rin po che thams cad de las 'byung pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar mi 'dod pa 'bab pa thams cad kyis mi 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa ni rdo rje ste /

analyzed: ri dang 'dra ba ni mi gyo ba dang mi 'gul ba'i phyir ro //

original: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni nor bu yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa ni nor bu yin te /

analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni ji ltar mos pa de bzhin du 'bras bu 'byor pas so //

analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa ni bkod ma'i chu yin te /

analyzed: chu 'dzin pa dang / mi zad pa'i chu mig dang chos mthun pas / thos pa dang ma thos pa'i @11a * //

analyzed: snyan par smra ba'i sgra dang 'dra zhing gdul bya thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis thos pa na dga' ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni tha dad pa med pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam yin te /

original: de dang ldan pa ni chu bo yin la /üîΩchu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni chu bo yin la / chu bo'i rgyun dang 'dra ba ste /

original: rang gi ngang gis 'bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'bab pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba la sogs pa'i bstan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa de dang ldan pa ni sprin yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ma chen mo gnyis las sems bskyed pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis brjod pa yin te /

analyzed: de la dang po ni 'dun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par ro //

analyzed: lhag ma ni de'i grogs kyi khyad par ro //

analyzed: de nyid sbyor ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thams cad kyang go rims bzhin du mi zad pa brgyad bcur brjod de dang po ni sems skyed pa nyid do ;

original: / lhag ma ni de'i grogs te /
analyzed: / lhag ma ni de'i grogs te /

original: sbyor ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bsam pa la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'o //

analyzed: dang po'i sems skyed pa ni gzhi mi zad pa ste /
translated: The first production of the thought is the inexhaustible basis.

analyzed: sbyor ba mi zad pa nas thabs la mkhas pa mi zad pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The inexhaustible application, etc., up to the inexhaustible skillful means.

original: de lta mod kyi ji ltar brgyad cur bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi ji ltar brgyad cur bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: But how is it to be made eighty?

analyzed: sems bskyed pa bcu pa gnyis pa'i dbye bas lhan cig tu byas nas drug cu rtsa brgyad du bya'o //

analyzed: bcu dang lhan cig tshad med dang // mngon shes bsdu dngos so sor rig / ston zung phyogs dang gnyis gnyis dang // chos mdo bgrod dang lhan cig tu //
translated: The ten together with the immeasurables, the superknowledges, the means of gathering, the individual certain knowledges, the pairs of wheels, the pairs, and the Dharma-summaries, are together with the progress.

original: rtsa gnyis sems bskyed bcu pa ni //
analyzed: rtsa gnyis sems bskyed bcu pa ni //
translated: The ten together with the two are the second production of the thought.

original: gnyis pa'i dbye bas mi zad pa//
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbye bas mi zad pa//

original: @11b phyogs dang lnga dang bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: @11b phyogs dang lnga dang bzhi dang ni //

analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir sdud pa pos shes rab can gyi mchog sh'a ri'i bu rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa smras so //

analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te zhes bya ba ni brjod par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid ci tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya bas smras so // bdag nyid zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la yod pa'o //

original: nye bar 'jog pa ni de nas brtan par gyur pa dang / rang bzhin gyis rags pa nyid kyis gzhan dag tu rnam par 'phro ba na gong nas gong du phra bar byed pas de nyid du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //

original: sems kyi nyes pa bdun gyis gsal nas 'bad pas de bzhin du rang gi ngang gis 'byung bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩmnyam par 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngang @14a * //

original: de thams cad dang bdag dang gzhan yang dag par mi shes pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par @16b byed pa de thams cad kyang mi shes pa yin te /

translated: He does not know all of that, nor does he know himself or others, nor does he know how to practice the perfections, nor does he know how to perfect the Buddha-qualities.

analyzed: de ltar spyod pa kun nas yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir lam yongs su 'dzin pa la gdams pa'o //

analyzed: de la sha'i spyan gyis ni gzugs rnams mthong ba yin no //

analyzed: lha'i spyan gyis ni gzugs med pa rnams dang 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mthong ba yin no //

analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan gyis ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: chos kyi spyan gyis ni 'phags pa'i gang zag dang de'i chos rnams yang dag par mi dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa yin te /

original: de ni spyan lnga la gdams pa'o ;
analyzed: de ni spyan lnga la gdams pa'o ;

original: / mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: / mngon par shes pa drug gang zhe na /

analyzed: lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pas ni sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'o //

original: 'di ni mngon par 'du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par 'du byas pa yin la /

original: snga ma'i lha'i mig ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i lha'i mig ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //

original: de ni mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa'o //

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas nas /

analyzed: des gang dang gang mthong ba'i don de mi snang ba yin te /

original: de ni bsgom pa'i lam la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i lam la gdams pa'o //

analyzed: 'byed pa'o // de'i cha dang yan lag 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha yin te /

original: de'i cha ni byed pa yin te /

translated: Its factor is activity.üîΩThose factors conducive to penetration are the cause of attaining discernment.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag kyang so sor 'byed pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir brten pa dang / cha dang thob pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa de dag kyang so sor 'byed pa thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir brten pa dang / cha dang thob pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: Therefore, the four are basis, factor, attainment, and cause.

original: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: drod dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos kyi mchog go //
translated: heat, peak, patience, and the supreme mundane state.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir dro ba'o //
translated: It is called heat because it is a sign of the fire of supramundane wisdom.

original: yun ring po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rtse mor gyur pa'i phyir rtse mo'o //
analyzed: yun ring po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rtse mor gyur pa'i phyir rtse mo'o //
translated: It is called peak because it is the peak of the roots of virtue that last for a long time.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la bzod pas na bzod pa'o //
translated: It is called patience because one has patience with the supreme mundane state.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi chos kyi mchog yin pas na chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyi chos kyi mchog yin pas na chos kyi mchog go //
translated: It is called the supreme mundane state because it is the supreme of all mundane dharmas.

original: de dag ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dag la yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs nas mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rnam par nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dag la yang yod de /
translated: They focus on the four noble truths and have the aspects of impermanence, suffering, and so on.

original: de dag las byang chub sems dpa' ni khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las byang chub sems dpa' ni khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas are superior to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas by five categories.

original: de bas na bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de bas na bstan bcos las /
translated: Therefore the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:üîΩBy object, aspect, cause,

original: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni rnam pa dang // rgyu dang yongs su 'dzin pa yis //
translated: and complete acceptance,

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi ;
translated: The bodhisattva is a protector,

original: / drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
analyzed: / drod sogs bdag nyid ji bzhin du //
translated: like the heat, etc. of the path of preparation.

original: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan brten pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog bzhi po ldan brten pa //
translated: He is distinguished from the disciples and solitary realizers

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: by his small, middling, and great heat, etc.

original: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: nyan thos bse ru lta bu dang // bcas pa dag las khyad par 'phags //
translated: He is distinguished from the disciples and solitary realizersüîΩby his small, middling, and great heat, etc.

original: sems can thams cad la skyob pa'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la skyob pa'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is a protector because he has the intention to protect all sentient beings.

original: gang chung ngu dang / chen po'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang chung ngu dang / chen po'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: His heat, etc. are small, middling, and great.

original: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi dro ba la sogs pa dag las /
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi dro ba la sogs pa dag las /
translated: From the heat, etc. of the disciples and solitary realizers,

original: shin tu khyad par du gyur pa rnam pa lngas khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: shin tu khyad par du gyur pa rnam pa lngas khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: he is distinguished by five kinds of distinction.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / theg pa gsum thob pa'i rgyu dang / yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / theg pa gsum thob pa'i rgyu dang / yang dag par yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He is distinguished by his object, his aspect, the cause of his attainment of the three vehicles, his perfect grasping, and his possession of the four conceptions.

original: ji ltar rang gi dro ba la sogs pa 'di dag gi so so re re la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi dro ba la sogs pa 'di dag gi so so re re la yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as these heat and so on are each divided into small, medium, and great, they are twelve.

original: de la dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni bden pa bzhi la mi rtag @17b pa la sogs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni bden pa bzhi la mi rtag @17b pa la sogs par shes pa'o //
translated: The object of small heat is the knowledge of impermanence and so on with regard to the four truths.

original: de'i rnam pa ni mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Its aspect is the cessation of manifest clinging and so on.

original: de yang bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de yang bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la gzugs mi rtag pa la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la kun 'byung ba spang bar bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of the truth of suffering is impermanence and so on of form and so forth, the object of the truth of origin is origin, which is to be abandoned and so on, and the object of the truth of cessation is cessation, which is to be manifested and so on.

original: rnam pa ni dmigs pa de dag la so sor mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / bden pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni dmigs pa de dag la so sor mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / bden pa ma yin par shes pa'o //
translated: Its aspect is the knowledge that those objects are not individually clung to, are not abided in and are not true.

original: mngon par zhen pa dang / gnas pa dang / bden pa'i shes pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang / gnas pa dang / bden pa'i shes pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation is the cessation of the knowledge of the truth of the path, of the knowledge of the truth of origination, and of the knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: lam gyi bden pa yang gzugs shes par bya /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yang gzugs shes par bya /
translated: The knowledge of the truth of the path is the knowledge of form,

original: gzugs des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but one should not become proud on account of that form.üîΩ... up to ... the knowledge of the Buddha qualities is the knowledge of form,

original: zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi bar du des kyang rlom sems su mi bya'o //
translated: but one should not become proud on account of those Buddha qualities.

original: chos thams cad shes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad shes pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of all dharmas is the objective support.

original: des rlom sems su mi bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: The absence of pride on account of that is the aspect.

original: de nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: This is also stated by [the passage beginning with] Furthermore... and so on.

original: gzhan yang zhes smos pas ni gdams ngag la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes smos pas ni gdams ngag la ltos pa'o //
translated: Furthermore is stated in order to show the dependence on instruction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni bden pa gsum dang 'brel ba'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni bden pa gsum dang 'brel ba'i mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: One practices the perfection of wisdom is the objective support, i.e. impermanence, etc. associated with the three truths.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa ni rnam pa ste /
translated: Without taking anything as a basis is the aspect.

original: mi dmigs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod pa'o //
translated: One practices without taking anything as a basis.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pas zhes bya ba smos pa ni rim gyis bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pas zhes bya ba smos pa ni rim gyis bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase by cultivating the perfection of wisdom means by cultivating it in sequence.

original: bden pa gsum gyi 'og tu lam gyi bden pa'i dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gsum gyi 'og tu lam gyi bden pa'i dmigs pa ni dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The objective support for the reality of the path is the absence of an objective support.

original: des rlom sems med pa ni rnam pa bsgoms pas shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des rlom sems med pa ni rnam pa bsgoms pas shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The absence of conceit in that is to be understood as the cultivation of the aspects.

original: de ltar bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med cing rlom sems med pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bslab par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par zhen pa med cing rlom sems med pa de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one should train in that way means that one should train in that way without settling down and without conceit.

original: des kyang zhes bya bas ni gang de'i sems mnyam pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya bas ni gang de'i sems mnyam pa med pa yin te /
translated: The phrase by that refers to the fact that his mind is not equal to that.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not common to the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, etc.

original: sems rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad du dus chad pa med par sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rnams kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rgya chen po rnam pa thams cad du dus chad pa med par sems can gyi don gyi bya ba rnams kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a vast mind, the source of all the activities that benefit sentient beings, because it is uninterrupted in all its aspects.

original: byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: The mind of enlightenment is the mind whose nature is enlightenment.

original: kyang gi sgra ni lhag pa'i don to//
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni lhag pa'i don to//
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúmoreover.‚Äù

original: @18a * // de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yod par 'dod de /
analyzed: @18a * // de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems ni sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yod par 'dod de /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas‚Äô mind is considered to be superior to the minds of all sentient beings.

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi byed na tha mal pa'i sems kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi byed na tha mal pa'i sems kyis lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If they do not become proud on account of that, what need is there to mention ordinary minds?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis de la rlom sems med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis de la rlom sems med pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what way is there no pride?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan smras so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan smras so //
translated: The answer is given by ‚Äúbecause it is thus,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems de ni sems ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems de ni sems ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis la de mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That mind is said to be ‚Äúwithout mind‚Äù because the duality of the grasped and the grasper does not appear in it.

original: gal te sems med na 'on kyang de sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te sems med na 'on kyang de sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba zhes smos so //
translated: If it is without mind, then how can it be said that ‚Äúthe nature of mind is clear light‚Äù?

original: ji ltar 'od gsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'od gsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it clear light?

original: gang gi phyir sems ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang dang po nas mi ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang dang po nas mi ldan pa yin te /
translated: Because the mind is not originally associated with attachment, etc.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis glo bur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For they are adventitious by nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyis kyang bral ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyis kyang bral ba med do //
translated: For that very reason, it is not subsequently dissociated.

original: sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes kyang rab 'byor gyis ston par bya pa'i phyir dris so //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes kyang rab 'byor gyis ston par bya pa'i phyir dris so //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra said this: although he knew that, he asked in order to teach.

original: de skad ces smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor gyis dris pa'i lan ston to //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rab 'byor gyis dris pa'i lan ston to //
translated: He said this, etc. shows the answer to the question.

original: de ni med do zhes bya ba de ni mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni med do zhes bya ba de ni mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It does not exist means it is not perceived,

original: sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no proof.

original: de nyid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it that it is,

original: gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a refutation.

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa las yang dag par 'das pa ni gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The refutation is the transcendence of both entity and non-entity.

original: yod dam zhes bya ba ni ci de med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yod dam zhes bya ba ni ci de med pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Is it existent? means is it non-existent?

original: de tsam gyis kyang rab 'byor gyis bsams pas gsal por ma gyur nas /
analyzed: de tsam gyis kyang rab 'byor gyis bsams pas gsal por ma gyur nas /
translated: But even that much was not clear to Subh≈´ti, who was thinking.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dris pa ni de gang yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dris pa ni de gang yin zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to make it clear, he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: rab 'byor gyi lan ni sems med pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi lan ni sems med pa de ni 'gyur ba med pa rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes smos te /
translated: Subh≈´ti‚Äôs answer is, ‚ÄúThat mind which is unmoving and nonconceptual.‚Äù

original: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang / 'gyur ba ma gos pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba dang / 'gyur ba ma gos pa'i phyir 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: It is unmoving because the mind is naturally luminous and unstained by movement.

original: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual because all conceptual elaboration is completely pacified and it is not the domain of any aspect.

original: de lta bas na de lta bu'i sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de lta bu'i sems kyis kyang rlom sems su mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not even falsely project such a mind.

original: de la yang sems med pa tsam gyi phyir te /
analyzed: de la yang sems med pa tsam gyi phyir te /
translated: Because there is no mind there,

original: sems stong pa nyid tsam las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems stong pa nyid tsam las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that it is just the emptiness of mind.

original: de ltar na sems de yang sems med pa yin te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal @18b ba ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems de yang sems med pa yin te rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal @18b ba ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus, that mind is also not a mind, because its nature is luminosity.

original: de la yang rlom sems med pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang rlom sems med pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: And the absence of conceit about that is the aspect.üîΩThe absence of mind in mind is the object.

original: ji ltar sems la sems med pa ste nye bar gzugs la sogs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa med pa nyid du don gyis shes pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems la sems med pa ste nye bar gzugs la sogs pa yang gzugs la sogs pa med pa nyid du don gyis shes pa yin no //
translated: The absence of form, etc. is understood by implication.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni sems med par yang dag par bstan pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni sems med par yang dag par bstan pa'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: Then, after the teaching of the absence of mind.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni rab tu ston pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni rab tu ston pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as, in the sense of just as.

original: ji ltar ston pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar ston pa yin zhe na //
translated: How is it taught?

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog nyid du gsungs pa de ltar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog nyid du gsungs pa de ltar ston pa yin no //

original: de gang gi mchog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi mchog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: In what is it supreme?

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la gnas pa'i'o //
translated: In the state of non-affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis la nyon mongs pa'i g-yul dang 'gal ba gcig po de ni 'dir mi bzung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis la nyon mongs pa'i g-yul dang 'gal ba gcig po de ni 'dir mi bzung ste /
translated: The meditative absorption of non-affliction is twofold. The one that is incompatible with the battle of afflictions is not taken here.

original: gnyis pa gnas skabs kyis de'i gnas pas gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa gnas skabs kyis de'i gnas pas gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the second is the state of abiding in that.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de ltar na dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dro ba chung du'o//
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de ltar na dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ni dro ba chung du'o//
translated: Therefore, thus, the distinctive object and aspect are the lesser warmth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral zhes bya ba des de'i gong nas gong du yang 'phel ba yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral zhes bya ba des de'i gong nas gong du yang 'phel ba yin te /
translated: Not separated from the perfection of wisdom indicates that it increases more and more.

original: de ni dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag go //
analyzed: de ni dro ba chung ngu'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag go //
translated: That is the distinctive object and aspect of lesser warmth.

original: dro ba chung ngu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir phyi ma dag tu yang rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dro ba chung ngu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir phyi ma dag tu yang rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is the context of lesser warmth, it should be applied to the latter stages as well.

original: rgyu'i khyad par bcu gnyis kyi dbang du yang bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par bcu gnyis kyi dbang du yang bya ste /
translated: It should also be applied to the twelve distinctive causes.

original: thob pa'i rgyu ni byang chub sems dpa'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu ni byang chub sems dpa'i dro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of attainment is the bodhisattva's warmth and so on.

original: bstan bcos las /
analyzed: bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: theg pa gsum char rgyu ba'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char rgyu ba'o // zhes bshad do //

analyzed: de ni phan tshun gyi ngo bo nyid ni 'di'i dmigs pa'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam pa'o //

analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas byang chub tu lung bstan to zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni dmigs pa gsungs so //

original: de ltar na byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste don dam par byang chub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste don dam par byang chub par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nyid sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de nyid sems dpa' ste /

original: 'di de'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di de'i bdag nyid yin te /

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa'o //

original: skabs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin chen po de nyid sems dpa' yin pas 'di nyid sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: skabs kyis ni ting nge 'dzin chen po de nyid sems dpa' yin pas 'di nyid sems dpa' chen po'o //

analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'di byang chub sems dpa' nyid yin zhe na /

original: skabs yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skabs yin pa'i phyir te /

original: des na gsum po 'di dag gi phan tshun gyi ngo bo nyid dang sa ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gsum po 'di dag gi phan tshun gyi ngo bo nyid dang sa ni dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba nas de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes ba ba'i bar gyis rnam pa bstan to //

analyzed: bstan par nus sam zhes bya ba ni tshig gis rab tu bstan pa'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin de yang mi shes //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang mi shes //

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin pas de ltar mi snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yin pas de ltar mi snang ba yin pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //

analyzed: yang dag par mi shes zhes bya ba ni brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //

original: de ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag go //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten chos kyi mchog chen po'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i khyad par dag go //

original: de nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de nas bstan bcos las /

analyzed: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //

analyzed: nges 'byed cha mthun zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi po de dag yin te /

analyzed: re re yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa ji skad bstan pa nyid kyis bcu gnyis bdag gis ji skad bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de rnam par rtog pa dang ldan @24a * //
analyzed: de rnam par rtog pa dang ldan @24a * //

original: par bshad par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: par bshad par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /

analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //

analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis // rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis // de ni so sor rnam pa dgu //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //

original: gzung bar rtog pa ni gzung par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzung bar rtog pa ni gzung par rnam par rtog pa'o //

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: gcig ni dngos po la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni dngos po la rnam par rtog pa yin te /

original: gang 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten la grags pa'i dngos po la'o //

original: cig shos ni de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: cig shos ni de'i gnyen po ste /

original: de yang so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de yang so sor rnam pa dgu'o //

original: ji ltar rmongs pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i bye brag ni ma rig pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar rmongs pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i bye brag ni ma rig pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: de nyid de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ston par mdzad pa yin no //

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin no zhas gsungs pa de ma thag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar slob na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa yin no zhas gsungs pa de ma thag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThen‚Äù means immediately after the statement ‚ÄúIf he trains thus, he trains in the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThis having been said‚Äù means

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin pas bstan par bya ba'i phyir skabs kyi sh'a ri'i bus gsol bar bya ba'i don du smras so //

original: chos gang la slob pa lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos gang la slob pa lags zhes bya ba la /

original: spyi sgra dang / yon tan dang / gtso bo dang / skyes bu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'am /üîΩ'on te phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos la dmigs nas bslab par bya /
analyzed: spyi sgra dang / yon tan dang / gtso bo dang / skyes bu la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'am / 'on te phung po dang khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa'i chos la dmigs nas bslab par bya /
translated: The word dharma is a general term for qualities, primary natures, persons, and so on,

original: zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes dgongs so //
translated: or it refers to the dharmas that are objects of observation such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang la yang mi slob bo zhes bka' stsal te /üîΩchos thams cad bdag med pa nyid la slob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang la yang mi slob bo zhes bka' stsal te / chos thams cad bdag med pa nyid la slob pa'i phyir /

original: zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes dgongs so //
translated: The thought is, Because one trains in the selflessness of all dharmas,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: zhes bya ba ni de chos thams cad la mi slob pa ga las she na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de chos thams cad la mi slob pa ga las she na /

original: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lan ni sh'a ri'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The answer is given in the passage beginning with Shariputra, and so on.

original: chos de ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang las la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos de ni zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang / yon tan dang las la sogs pa'o //

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù refers to its nature.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'i ngo bos mngon par chags shing bden pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu'i ngo bos mngon par chags shing bden pa nyid du'o //

original: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste de yang byis pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni 'phags pa ma yin pa ste de yang byis pa'o //

original: gang gi phyir thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni thos pa mang po med pa'o /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni thos pa mang po med pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is not learned‚Äù is one who does not have much learning.

analyzed: 'o na da ji lta bur @24b mchis zhes bya ba ni ji lta bur rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: ji ltar med pa zhes bya ba ni yod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn what way is it not?‚Äù means ‚Äúit is,‚Äù

analyzed: gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par yod de zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir dang / brdzun pa'i ngo bos snang ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just like that‚Äù means ‚Äúit is not,‚Äù because it appears as a false nature.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i rigs pas so //

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni brdzun pa'o //

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de ni yul gyi rnam par rtog pa bstan te /

analyzed: de ni ma rig pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po'o //

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bos so //

analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: med pa la zhes bya ba ni byis pas bzung ba'i dngos po yod pa'o //

analyzed: brtags so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du dngos po nyid du bzung ba'o //

original: de ni phung por brtags pa ste ;
analyzed: de ni phung por brtags pa ste ;
translated: This is the conceptualization of the aggregates.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa'o //

original: mtha' gnyis la zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis la zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //

original: zhen pas zhes bya ba ni kun nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pas zhes bya ba ni kun nas gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù means complete fixation.

original: ga las she na /
analyzed: ga las she na /

original: chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid la nges par mi byed pa ste /

original: sbyor ba'i lam thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi mthong ste zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi rtog pa med pa ste /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas mngon par chags te zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni mjug bsdu ba'o //

original: de ni mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rtog pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mtha' gnyis la chags pa'i rtog pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third conception, the conception of attachment to the two extremes.

original: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' gnyis la gnas pa'o //

original: de'i gzhis zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhis zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: ‚Äú On that basis‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa'o //

original: gnas nas zhes bya ba ni rten pa'o //
analyzed: gnas nas zhes bya ba ni rten pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú From that‚Äù means ‚Äúfrom that basis.‚Äù

original: ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pas zhes bya ba ni ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po gzugs ni gzugs kyi phung po yin te /

original: de gnyis ka ni ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de gnyis ka ni ming dang gzugs so //

analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa ste ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa ste rnam par rtog pa bzhi pa'o //

analyzed: lnga po gzhan ni brtag par bya ba yin te / gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di @25a * //

original: dag ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes mi shes mi mthong ba yin no //

analyzed: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste lnga pa'o //

analyzed: de dag ni stong pa nyid la dad par mi byed cing pha rol tu phyin pa dag la mi gnas pa yin te /

analyzed: de ni 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste drug pa'o //

original: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dag la dmigs pa ni nges par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dag la dmigs pa ni nges par mi 'byung ste /

original: de ni lam la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lam la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh conception, that of the path.

original: de bdag dang chos la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de bdag dang chos la dmigs pa yin te /
