translated: This is the eighth conception, that of the self.üîΩThe purity of nonproduction, nonoccurrence, and nonperformance is the ninth conception.

original: ma spangs pa de bas na de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma spangs pa de bas na de dag dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: These nine conceptions are not attenuated and not abandoned, and therefore he possesses them.

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa bsrabs par byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa'i mun pa bsrabs par byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he attenuates the darkness of conception,

original: snang ba thob pa'i teng nge 'dzin la brten pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: snang ba thob pa'i teng nge 'dzin la brten pa zhes bya ba bstan te /
translated: he is said to attain the concentration of light.

original: de ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: These are the first nine types of discriminations of the apprehended.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to the second, he says, ‚ÄúBy them,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll phenomena‚Äù refers to the aggregates and so on.

original: brtags so zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: brtags so zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa dgu gzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúImagined‚Äù means that they are apprehended in nine aspects by the divisions of the aggregates and so on.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dbye bas phung po la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por brtags pa'i dbye bas phung po la sogs pas rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: The discriminations of the aggregates and so on are ninefold by the divisions of the imagined entities of the aggregates and so on.

original: de la gzugs su rnam par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du zhen pa de ni phung po'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs su rnam par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du zhen pa de ni phung po'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Among them, the discrimination of form and the adherence to it up to the discrimination of consciousness and the adherence to it is the discrimination of the meaning of the aggregates.

original: mig tu rnam par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nas chos kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa de ni skye ba'i sgo'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mig tu rnam par rtog cing mngon par zhen pa nas chos kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa de ni skye ba'i sgo'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The discrimination of the eye and the adherence to it up to the discrimination of phenomena and the adherence to them is the discrimination of the meaning of the sense bases.

original: ming dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
translated: The conception of the realms of name-and-form, eye, and visual consciousness,

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa de ni rigs kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du mngon par zhen pa de ni rigs kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: up to the conception of the realms of mind, mental objects, and mental consciousness is the conception of the meaning of family.

original: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar ni skye ba'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar ni skye ba'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of ignorance up to old age and death is the conception of the meaning of birth.

original: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni stong @25b pa nyid kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni stong @25b pa nyid kyi don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the emptinesses, from the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, is the conception of the meaning of emptiness.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the six perfections is the conception of the meaning of the perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is the conception of the meaning of the path of seeing.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conception of the concentrations, formless [absorptions], and meditative attainments is the conception of the meaning of the path of meditation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata up to the knowledge of all modes are the discriminations of the path of no-more-learning.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi skyon bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dag gi skyon bstan to //
translated: The phrase by these and so on indicates the faults of these discriminations.

original: lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bdag med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i lam bdag med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The phrase the path as it really is refers to the non-erroneous path, the knowledge of selflessness.

original: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: The phrase reality means thatness.

original: mtha' ni mchog dang rtse mo ste //
analyzed: mtha' ni mchog dang rtse mo ste //
translated: The phrase the very limit of reality means the summit.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase the very limit of reality means emptiness.

original: grangs su zhes bya ba ni brtsis su'o //
analyzed: grangs su zhes bya ba ni brtsis su'o //
translated: The phrase in number means in enumeration.

original: rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di dag ni rtse mo'i'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dgu po 'di dag ni rtse mo'i'o //
translated: These nine discriminations are the discriminations of the summit.

original: srab mor byas pa dang ma spangs pa de bas na de dag dang ldan pa ni snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong pa nyid de /
analyzed: srab mor byas pa dang ma spangs pa de bas na de dag dang ldan pa ni snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong pa nyid de /
translated: The phrase having made them weak and not abandoned them means that one who possesses them abandons the previous nine discriminations.

original: de bas na snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na snang ba mched pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, one abides in the meditative stabilization of the radiance.

original: de ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the second type of discrimination of the apprehended, in nine aspects.

original: 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the two types of discrimination of the apprehender, the treatise states:üîΩIn terms of the self and so on, the nature of independence,

original: bdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang // de bzhin phung sogs rten sgo nas //üîΩrdzas dang brtags pa'i rten can gyis //
analyzed: bdag sogs rang dbang ngo bo dang // de bzhin phung sogs rten sgo nas // rdzas dang brtags pa'i rten can gyis //
translated: and likewise, in terms of the aggregates and so on, the basis,üîΩthere is the apprehender,üîΩwhich is asserted to be twofold:

original: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: based on substance and based on imputation.

original: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The apprehender is the discrimination of the apprehender.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold:

original: rdzas la rten pa dang / brtags pa la rten pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la rten pa dang / brtags pa la rten pa'o //
translated: based on substance and based on imputation.

original: rten ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rten ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: The basis is the object of reference.

original: de yang go rims bzhin du bdag la sogs pa rang dbang can dang / phung po la sogs pa la rten pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang go rims bzhin du bdag la sogs pa rang dbang can dang / phung po la sogs pa la rten pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is, respectively, based on the self and so on, which are independent, and on the aggregates and so on, which are the basis.

original: 'dir yang de ni so sor rnam pa dgu zhes rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang de ni so sor rnam pa dgu zhes rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: Here, it should be added that each of these is of nine types.üîΩWith regard to the first, the treatise states:

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas de dag chos bden pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas de dag chos bden pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: In terms of the phenomena of the truths and so on...

original: de dag ces bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni byis pa so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The those refers to the foolish ordinary beings.

original: chos bden pa zhe bya ba ni yang dag pa'i bden pa'i don bdag med pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos bden pa zhe bya ba ni yang dag pa'i bden pa'i don bdag med pa mthong ba'o //
translated: The truth of the Dharma refers to the insight into the meaning of the truth of selflessness.

original: yid mi ches so zhes bya ba ni gus par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: yid mi ches so zhes bya ba ni gus par mi byed pa ste /
translated: The do not believe refers to the lack of respect.

original: bdag nyid rnam pa dgur rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam pa dgur rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the ninefold conception of self.

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' chos gang la yang zhen par mi byed pa yin te bdag nyid du @26a * //üîΩdmigs par mi byed ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpa' chos gang la yang zhen par mi byed pa yin te bdag nyid du @26a * // dmigs par mi byed ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The and so on indicates that the bodhisattva does not cling to any dharma, because he does not apprehend it as a self.

original: de nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa rnam pa dgu'i mi mthun pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mi dmigs pa rnam pa dgu'i mi mthun pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
translated: By that very fact, the nine non-apprehensions are the nine conceptions of the opposite of non-apprehension.

original: bdag dang sems can dang mthong ba po'i bar du bstan du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas de ni rang dbang gi bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang mthong ba po'i bar du bstan du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas de ni rang dbang gi bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The self is non-apprehended because it is not taught as a sentient being up to a seer. That is the conception of self as independent.

original: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis bdag nyid du mi dmigs pas de ni gcig gi bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis bdag nyid du mi dmigs pas de ni gcig gi bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Since the self is not perceived as having the nature of form up to consciousness, this is the conceptualization of a single nature.

original: mi gnas yid kyi bar dang gzugs nas chos kyi bar mi dmigs pas de ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas yid kyi bar dang gzugs nas chos kyi bar mi dmigs pas de ni rgyu'i bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Since the mind that does not abide up to form up to dharmas are not perceived, this is the conceptualization of a causal nature.

original: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: From eye, form, and eye consciousness up to

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ni lta ba'i bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //üîΩrten cing 'brel par byung ba nas gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ni lta ba'i bdag nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o // rten cing 'brel par byung ba nas gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bar ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: mind, dharmas, and mind consciousness is the conceptualization of the nature of view.üîΩFrom dependent origination up to the formless realm is the conceptualization of the nature of the basis of affliction.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: From the first concentration up to the formless absorptions is the conceptualization of the nature of the basis of freedom from attachment.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni mthong ba po'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa ni mthong ba po'i gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The four noble truths are the conceptualization of the basis of the one who sees.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsgom pa'i gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu ni bsgom pa'i gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions are the conceptualization of the basis of cultivation.

original: stobs bcu dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi dmigs pas de ni don byas pa nyid kyi gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la yang mi dmigs pas de ni don byas pa nyid kyi gzhi'i bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Up to the ten powers and the knowledge of all aspects, since they are not apprehended, that is the conceptualization of the basis of the one who has accomplished the aim.

original: bzod pa dgu po 'di dag srab par byed /
analyzed: bzod pa dgu po 'di dag srab par byed /
translated: These nine acceptances make [the afflictions] thin,

original: spong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: spong bar mi byed de /
translated: but they do not abandon them.

original: de bas na 'di dag dang ldan pas ni snga ma de dag nyid spong bar byed pa nyid de de bas na gzung bar bya ba med pa gcig tu nges par yod pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig tu zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag dang ldan pas ni snga ma de dag nyid spong bar byed pa nyid de de bas na gzung bar bya ba med pa gcig tu nges par yod pa'i phyir de kho na nyid kyi don la phyogs gcig tu zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin
translated: Therefore, those who possess these abandon those [afflictions] themselves. Therefore, since there is only the non-existence of the apprehended, one enters one-sidedly into the meaning of reality,

original: la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: la gnas pa yin no //
translated: and abides in concentration.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sh'a ri'i bus zur gyis zhus pa gsungs so //üîΩzhu ba ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sh'a ri'i bus zur gyis zhus pa gsungs so // zhu ba ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Thus have I heard, etc.

original: gal te de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de'i tshe 'di la ji ltar mi dmigs pa zhe na /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gal te de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de'i tshe 'di la ji ltar mi dmigs pa zhe na / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The question is: If he is training in omniscience, how can he not apprehend anything?

original: de la yang mi slob pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang mi slob pa ste /
translated: The Lord replies: In that, too, he does not train.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that he does not train by way of apprehending anything.

original: de ltar slob na zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @26b slob pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar slob na zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @26b slob pa'o //
translated: Thus training, etc. means training by way of nonapprehension.

original: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sa thams cad kyi yon tan thob pa la'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni sa thams cad kyi yon tan thob pa la'o //
translated: In all dharmas means in the attainment of the excellences of all the stages.

original: de ltar bstan pa 'di 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa 'di 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po dgu'o //
translated: Thus the first nine thoughts are those of one who holds this teaching.üîΩThen the Lord, etc.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci sgyu ma'i skyes bu 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The idea behind the question Is this illusory man . . . ?

original: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: is this:

original: gal te chos kyi mchog 'di la byang chub la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi mchog 'di la byang chub la slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: If one were to say that the bodhisattva who trains in enlightenment with regard to this supreme reality is like an illusory person,

original: de lta na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang slob par 'gyur 'gyur zhing de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na sgyu ma'i skyes bu yang slob par 'gyur 'gyur zhing de nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: then one would have to say that an illusory person would train and would certainly emerge.

original: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this Subh≈´ti, therefore, etc. is stated.

original: gal te sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu nyid du ni mi 'dod de rgyu de bas na'o //
analyzed: gal te sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bu nyid du ni mi 'dod de rgyu de bas na'o //
translated: If one does not accept that he is like an illusory person, then for that reason

original: na zhes bya ba tshig gi rgyun du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: na zhes bya ba tshig gi rgyun du smras pa yin no //
translated: the statement is continued.üîΩI will question you about that.

original: khyed nyid la dri bar byas zhes bya ba ni dang dris pa de nyid la dri bar byas pa'o //üîΩci nus pa zhes bya ba ni ci 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khyed nyid la dri bar byas zhes bya ba ni dang dris pa de nyid la dri bar byas pa'o // ci nus pa zhes bya ba ni ci 'dod pa'o //
translated: I will question you about that very question.üîΩTo the best of your ability.üîΩTo the best of your desire.üîΩTeach.

original: ston cig ces bya ba ni shod cig pa'o //
analyzed: ston cig ces bya ba ni shod cig pa'o //
translated: Speak.üîΩListen.

original: ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: Listen as if you were taking it to yourself.üîΩThis.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni tshig nye bar dgod pa'o //
translated: This is a statement of the topic.

original: ji zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ji zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is a question.

original: ji phung po gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji phung po gzhan la sgyu ma yang gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúAre the aggregates and the illusion different?‚Äù

original: sgyu ma nyid kyang phung po zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis dris pa'i lan no //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid kyang phung po zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis dris pa'i lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe illusion itself is the aggregates‚Äù is Subh≈´ti‚Äôs answer.

original: don dang sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'i don bzhin du yang dag par snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: don dang sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'i don bzhin du yang dag par snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of illusion is not the appearance of real things, like the things conjured up by a magician.

original: de ni 'dir sgyu ma'i sgra'i don to //
analyzed: de ni 'dir sgyu ma'i sgra'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the word ‚Äúillusion‚Äù here.

original: de bas na sgyu ma nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sgyu ma nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be ‚Äújust an illusion.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma'i don bstan nas skyes bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don bstan nas skyes bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the meaning of illusion, in order to teach the meaning of person, he says:

original: 'dir ni 'du shes kun shes pa brtags pa tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba la khyad par du dpyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'du shes te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'du shes kun shes pa brtags pa tha snyad yin no zhes bya ba la khyad par du dpyod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'du shes te /
translated: Here, the investigation of the knowledge of perception is conventional.

original: shes pa dang blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Perception is the meaning of consciousness and mind.

original: byis pa rnams drang ba'i ched du brtags pa ni brtags pa ste de dag log pa nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams drang ba'i ched du brtags pa ni brtags pa ste de dag log pa nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Investigation is a designation for the sake of guiding the childish, because they do not understand it to be false.

original: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa thams cad 'dis tha snyad du byed pas na tha snyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa thams cad 'dis tha snyad du byed pas na tha snyad do //
translated: Conventional is so called because it is used by all, noble and non-noble.

original: de la 'phags pas ni brtags pa logs pa nyid du rtogs pas gzhan la rton par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pas ni brtags pa logs pa nyid du rtogs pas gzhan la rton par byed pa'o //
translated: The noble use it, knowing it to be false imagination, and so they rely on the other, i.e. on the ultimate.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pas ni bden pa nyid du shes nas bdag nyid kyang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pas ni bden pa nyid du shes nas bdag nyid kyang 'jug par byed do //
translated: The non-noble use it, knowing it to be the truth, and so they engage in it.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba 'dis ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, this refers to the teaching.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa rnams rjes su bstan @27a * //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la zhes bya ba ni ming la sogs pa rnams rjes su bstan @27a * //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates is a subsequent explanation of name, etc.

original: pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang bdag med pa dag la byang chub sems dpa'o zhes brtags pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa dang bdag med pa dag la byang chub sems dpa'o zhes brtags pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the imputation of the bodhisattva on the non-existent and the selfless.

original: de bas na 'di ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni spyi'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the person of illusion. This is the general meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de de bzhin no //
translated: Blessed One, it is so.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' ba'i phyir lan gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni yongs su dga' ba'i phyir lan gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase Thus it is, O Sugata! is stated twice in order to express complete joy.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid du sgrub cing bstan par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa'i lan yongs su gsal bar btab par mtshan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sgyu ma'i skyes bu nyid du sgrub cing bstan par bya ba'i phyir bskal pa'i lan yongs su gsal bar btab par mtshan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase Therefore... and so on indicates that the question is asked in order to establish and demonstrate the fact that the bodhisattva is like an illusory person.

original: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' bslab par bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa' bslab par bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la'o //
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva's training is in perfect enlightenment means that the bodhisattva's training is in perfect enlightenment.

original: slob pas zhes bya ba ni slob par byed pa'i rgyu la ste /
analyzed: slob pas zhes bya ba ni slob par byed pa'i rgyu la ste /
translated: The phrase through training... means that the cause of training is...üîΩFor example, the text states:

original: dper na / bung ba nyal nas 'phel byed la //
analyzed: dper na / bung ba nyal nas 'phel byed la //
translated: The bee, lying down, increases;

original: pad ma'i rtsa ba gnas nas skyes //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pad ma'i rtsa ba gnas nas skyes // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: born from the lotus root,

original: gang gi phyir de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni sems dang ldan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa ni sems dang ldan pa'i phyir la /
translated: The phrase because of that... means that the bodhisattva who is training in the perfection of wisdom is endowed with mind...

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu ni yid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu ni yid med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ...while the person emanated by the magician is devoid of mind.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar bdag byid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i skyes bu dang 'dra bar bdag byid mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase like an illusory person means that one sees oneself as like a person conjured up by a magician.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag nyid de ltar mthong ba ni dka' ba yin na /
analyzed: bdag nyid de ltar mthong ba ni dka' ba yin na /
translated: If it is difficult to see oneself in that way,

original: de ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar shes she na /
translated: how is that known?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'o don ni sgyu ma ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i dngos po'o don ni sgyu ma ste /
translated: The meaning of an illusory thing conjured up by a magician is an illusion.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
translated: A person who is like that is an illusory person.

original: gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni nges par bya'o //
translated: One should apprehend means that one should ascertain.

original: gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzung bar snang ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni gzung bar snang ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase form is like an illusion means that it is an entity that appears as an object.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni nang dang 'dra ba'o //üîΩde zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni nang dang 'dra ba'o // de zhes bya ba ni de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The phrase that which refers to the inner.üîΩ The phrase this which refers to what is like that.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni de dag dang 'dra ba ste //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni de dag dang 'dra ba ste //
translated: The phrase these which refers to what is like those.

original: 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i dngos po yang med pa'i phyir zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that one should apprehend them as like illusions, because the entities that are subjects do not exist.

original: phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa med na 'di la sems dang ldan pa ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched la sogs pa med na 'di la sems dang ldan pa ci zhig ce na /
translated: If the aggregates, bases, and elements do not exist, what is it that has mind?

original: sems dang ldan pa'i phung po la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems dang ldan pa'i phung po la sogs pa ni 'khrul pa nyid de /
translated: The aggregates, etc. that have mind are just errors.

original: phung po la sogs pa ni yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ni yin pa ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are not real.

original: sprul pa'i skyes bu ni sprul pa yang med do //
analyzed: sprul pa'i skyes bu ni sprul pa yang med do //
translated: A magical person does not have a magical creation.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i gzhung dag la yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa'i gzhung dag la yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the passages on feeling, etc.

original: skye mched drug la yang la lar skyes bu btags pa yod de de ni zhar la dbang po drug bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug la yang la lar skyes bu btags pa yod de de ni zhar la dbang po drug bzung ba yin no //
translated: In some cases, a person is imputed to the six bases, which are grasped as the six sense faculties.

original: @27b skabs kyis ni phung po la sogs pa la skyes bur btags pa yin no //
analyzed: @27b skabs kyis ni phung po la sogs pa la skyes bur btags pa yin no //
translated: In some cases, a person is imputed to the aggregates, etc.

original: lhag ma ni ci rigs par btags par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci rigs par btags par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be imputed as appropriate.

original: de ltar na btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar na btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus there are nine imputations of conceptual thought.

original: sgyu ma nyid gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du ni phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du ni phung por btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúillusion itself is form‚Äù up to ‚Äúillusion itself is consciousness‚Äù is the imputation of the aggregates.

original: sgyu ma nyid mig ces bya ba nas chos zhes bya ba'i bar ni skye mched rnams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid mig ces bya ba nas chos zhes bya ba'i bar ni skye mched rnams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The illusion itself is the eye, etc., up to the illusion itself is the mental object, is the discrimination of the sense-fields.

original: sgyu ma nyid mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / sgyu ma nyid yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / sgyu ma nyid nam mkha'i khams kyi bar dang // sgyu ma nyid rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ni khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid mig dang gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / sgyu ma nyid yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dang / sgyu ma nyid nam mkha'i khams kyi bar dang // sgyu ma nyid rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar ni khams su btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The illusion itself is the eye, form, and eye-consciousness, the illusion itself is the mental organ, mental objects, and mental consciousness, up to the illusion itself is the element of space, and the illusion itself is the element of consciousness, is the discrimination of the elements.

original: sgyu ma nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The illusion itself is dependent origination.

original: sgyu ma nyid ma rig pa dang / sgyu ma nyid rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rten cing 'bral par 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid ma rig pa dang / sgyu ma nyid rga shi zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rten cing 'bral par 'byung bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The illusion itself is ignorance, the illusion itself is old age and death, is the discrimination of dependent origination.

original: sgyu ma nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang bar btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The illusion itself is the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, is the discrimination of purification.

original: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smos pa med nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smos pa med nyid ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness‚Äù is a conceptualization imputed to the path of seeing.

original: sgyu ma nyid bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni bsgom pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the meditative stabilizations and formless absorptions‚Äù is a conceptualization imputed to the path of cultivation.

original: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid thams cad ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid stong pa nyid thams cad ces bya ba ni khyad par gyi lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is all emptinesses‚Äù is a conceptualization imputed to the path of distinction.

original: sgyu ma nyid stobs bcu nas sgyu ma nyid byang chub ces bya ba'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma nyid stobs bcu nas sgyu ma nyid byang chub ces bya ba'i bar ni mi slob pa'i lam du btags pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIllusion itself is the ten powers, up to illusion itself is awakening‚Äù is a conceptualization imputed to the path of no learning.

original: chos kyi mchog gis dgu po 'di dag srab par byed cing mi spong ba dang / de dag dang ldan pa ni snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong bar byed de //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog gis dgu po 'di dag srab par byed cing mi spong ba dang / de dag dang ldan pa ni snga ma'i rnam par rtog pa dgu spong bar byed de //
translated: These nine [paths] are weakened by the supreme mundane state but are not abandoned, and one who possesses them abandons the nine conceptualizations of the former [paths].

original: nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston par byed de bar chad byed par nus pa ni bar chad do //
analyzed: nas bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston par byed de bar chad byed par nus pa ni bar chad do //
translated: The uninterrupted meditative stabilization teaches the uninterrupted path.üîΩThe uninterrupted path is able to interrupt the afflictions.

original: bar chad byed par mi nus pa ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad byed par mi nus pa ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The immediately preceding condition is not able to interrupt the afflictions.

original: de dag las she na /
analyzed: de dag las she na /
translated: From what?

original: de'i de ma thag nyid du mthong ba'i lam skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i de ma thag nyid du mthong ba'i lam skye ba yin te /
translated: The path of seeing arises immediately after that.

original: des ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu bstan to //
translated: This teaches the second type of conception, which is ninefold.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i khyad par bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi dbang @28a * //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i khyad par bstan pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gyi dbang @28a * //
translated: Thus, this teaches the four types of conception that are possessed.

original: du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise declares:

original: sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs //
translated: Non-discouragement and so on

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //üîΩde yi mi mthun phyogs bar ba //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed // de yi mi mthun phyogs bar ba //
translated: teach the absence of entityness and so on.üîΩThe four conceptions

original: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: are fully possessed in all aspects.

original: rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four conceptions are fully possessed in all aspects.üîΩThe four conceptions are fully possessed in all aspects.

original: gang yongs su bzung bas byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rjes su 'gro zhing lam ma yin pas ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yongs su bzung bas byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rjes su 'gro zhing lam ma yin pas ma yin te /
translated: By holding what, does the bodhisattva follow the path and not the non-path?

original: 'di lta ste thabs mkhas pas dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang de gnyis kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di lta ste thabs mkhas pas dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang de gnyis kyis kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su spong ngo //
translated: It is as follows: by skill in means and by the spiritual mentor, and by those two, one avoids the adverse side.

original: de la thabs mkhas pas ni sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pas ni sems mi 'gong ba nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: By skill in means, one does not become discouraged, etc.

original: rgyu la 'bras bur btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bur btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is designated by the effect.

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed pa ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen no //
translated: The spiritual mentor is the one who teaches the lack of own-being, etc.

original: de nyid kyi skabs bstan pa'i phyir theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi skabs bstan pa'i phyir theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, ‚Äúthe beginner in the vehicle‚Äù, etc.

original: mngon du gyur pas 'jigs pa ni skrag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pas 'jigs pa ni skrag pa'o //
translated: Fear is dread in regard to what is manifest.

original: skrag zin pa ni dang ngas pa'o //
analyzed: skrag zin pa ni dang ngas pa'o //
translated: Dread is fear.

original: de nyid kyi rgyu ni shin tu dang nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rgyu ni shin tu dang nges pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is great fear.

original: bstan pa 'di thos na zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bur bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di thos na zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bur bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen he hears this teaching‚Äù refers to the teaching about the illusory person.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i lag tu song na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i lag tu song na ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If it falls into the hands of a bodhisattva, it should be connected with ‚Äúif it falls into the hands of a bodhisattva‚Äù.

original: ji lta bu'i lag tu song na zhes na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i lag tu song na zhes na /
translated: In what kind of hands does it fall?

original: sems dpa' chen po sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song na'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song na'o //
translated: If it falls into the hands of a great being, a sinful friend.

original: 'dir ma zhes bya ba'i sgra rtogs par bya ste/ sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar gyur pa'am zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma zhes bya ba'i sgra rtogs par bya ste/ sdig pa'i grogs po'i lag tu song bar gyur pa'am zhes bya'o //
translated: Here the word ‚Äúif‚Äù is to be understood: ‚Äúif it falls into the hands of a sinful friend‚Äù.

original: des ba ma yin pa dang / mi mkhas pa dang / thabs mkhas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des ba ma yin pa dang / mi mkhas pa dang / thabs mkhas pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not gentle, not skilled, not skillful.

original: sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dpa' chen po'i lag tu ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste don gyis de ltar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems dpa' chen po'i lag tu ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste don gyis de ltar bstan pa yin no //
translated: A great being who is not in the hands of a great being is called that, and it is taught with that meaning.

original: thabs mi mkhas pa yongs su gtong ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba rnams mi yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis po dag go //
analyzed: thabs mi mkhas pa yongs su gtong ba dang / sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su spong ba rnams mi yongs su 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis po dag go //
translated: The two kinds of not holding on to people are: giving up the unskilled, and avoiding sinful friends.

original: de bas na rab 'byor dal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor dal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, slowly, etc. is stated.

original: sems dpa' mdzangs pa thabs mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: sems dpa' mdzangs pa thabs mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is wise, skilled in means.

original: de gang dag la chen po yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de gang dag la chen po yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who have this are called ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu song ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag tu song ba'o //
translated: They have gone into the hands of the spiritual teacher.

original: 'dir yang 'am zhes bya ba ni sgra rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'am zhes bya ba ni sgra rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is understood.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa gzhan gnyis yin no //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yongs su 'dzin pa gzhan gnyis yin no //
translated: The other two kinds of taking up are the skillful means and the spiritual teacher.

original: de la gang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par @28b nges shing bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i yi shes kyis dge ba'i chos rnams spyod cing de dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba de ni thabs mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par @28b nges shing bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i mi dmigs pa'i yi shes kyis dge ba'i chos rnams spyod cing de dag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba de ni thabs mkhas pa'o //
translated: Here, the skillful means is the practice of wholesome dharmas with the nonapprehending knowledge that is endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, and the dedication of those wholesome dharmas to complete knowing.

original: de la bzlog pa ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzlog pa ni thabs la mi mkhas pa'o //

analyzed: yang na rnam pa bdun te gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa'i dbye bas so //

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen po bstan nas sgro 'dogs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i gnyen po bstan nas sgro 'dogs pa'i gnyen po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the antidote to denial, in order to teach the antidote to reification,

original: 'on kyang gang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBut, Subh≈´ti, from where would a Bodhisattva come?‚Äù up to ‚ÄúThe Lord having said this, Subh≈´ti, the noble son, said to the Lord: ‚ÄòThe Bodhisattva is said to be one who has set out in the perfection.‚Äô ‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bstan pa la de dag gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa lnga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bstan pa la de dag gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa lnga bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having taught ‚Äúone who has set out in the perfection,‚Äù its characteristics should be explained in five aspects:

original: go rims bzhin du rigs dang / smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / gzhi dang ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rigs dang / smon lam dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / gzhi dang ngo bo nyid de /
translated: lineage, aspiration, superior intention, basis, and essence.

original: rigs ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: rigs ni chos nyid do //
translated: Lineage is the intrinsic nature.

original: gzhi ni yul lo //
analyzed: gzhi ni yul lo //
translated: Basis is the object.

original: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas te byang chub kyi sems kyis snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pas dngos po thams cad gtong ba dang // de bzhin du spong ba thams cad cig car srung ba @35a * //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas te byang chub kyi sems kyis snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i bsam pas dngos po thams cad gtong ba dang // de bzhin du spong ba thams cad cig car srung ba @35a * //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality is the simultaneous protection of all the precepts.üîΩSimilarly, the perfection of patience is the patient acceptance of all suffering in every respect.

original: dang ; de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang // de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi tshogs sgrub par byed pa nyid ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyin pa dang //
analyzed: dang ; de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du sdug bsngal thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang // de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi tshogs sgrub par byed pa nyid ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du sbyin pa dang //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of effort is the accomplishment of the accumulation of all the virtuous dharmas by means of the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: tshul khrims dang ; bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ; bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid do //
translated: The perfections of generosity, morality, patience, and effort are in that order.

original: de bzhin du las thams cad la lus dang ngag dang yid rnam pa thams cad du dbang du byas nas rnam pa thams cad du sems gnas pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rnam pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du las thams cad la lus dang ngag dang yid rnam pa thams cad du dbang du byas nas rnam pa thams cad du sems gnas pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rnam pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Likewise, in all actions, one controls body, speech, and mind in every way, and one stabilizes the mind in every way and fully discerns the aspects of all phenomena.

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du bstan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: These are, respectively, the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: With regard to the first, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says:üîΩConcentration, the formless realm, generosity, and so forth,üîΩthe path, love, and so forth,üîΩthe absence of reference points,üîΩthe three spheres of purity,

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang ; ched du bya dang mngon shes drug //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang ; ched du bya dang mngon shes drug //
translated: the purpose, and the six superknowledgesüîΩare the way to enter into

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //üîΩ'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la //üîΩ'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni // 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la // 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects.üîΩOne should understand thatüîΩthe practice of entering

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is the way to ascend to the Great Vehicle.

original: de dag ni sgrub pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de dag ni sgrub pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: These are the nine types of practice.

original: yul gyi dbye bas so //
analyzed: yul gyi dbye bas so //
translated: They are distinguished by their objects.

original: yul gyi bdun pa yin te bsam gtan gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yul gyi bdun pa yin te bsam gtan gzugs med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The seventh case is the object of the four absorptions and the four formless states.

original: de la bsam gtan bzhi las dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan bzhi las dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first absorption has five members:üîΩinitial inquiry, investigation, joy, pleasure, and concentration of mind.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Initial inquiry and investigation are the members that are antidotes.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Joy and pleasure are the members that are benefits.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni zhi gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: The concentration of mind is the member that is calm abiding.

original: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The second absorption has four members:

original: nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: inner clarity, which is the member that is an antidote,

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: and the remaining three, which are the same as before.

original: gsum pa ni yan lag ste //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yan lag ste //
translated: The third absorption has five members:üîΩequanimity, mindfulness, introspection, pleasure, and concentration of mind.

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: Equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are the members that are antidotes.

original: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Pleasure is the member that is a benefit.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The remaining two are the same as before.

original: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth absorption has four members:

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag go //
translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain, and concentration of mind.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: The sensation that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant is the branch of benefit.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as above.

original: gzugs med pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: The formless [absorptions] are fourfold.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du @35b shes las yang dag par 'das nas thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skyed mched sdo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du @35b shes las yang dag par 'das nas thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cing sna tshogs kyi 'du shes yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skyed mched sdo //
translated: Having completely transcended the perception of form, having ceased the perception of obstruction, not paying attention to the perception of diversity, thinking space is infinite, one enters and abides in the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das nas rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skyed mched do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i 'du shes las yang dag par 'das nas rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skyed mched do //
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite space, thinking consciousness is infinite, one enters and abides in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: shes bya dang shes pa'i 'du shes dag las yang dag par 'das nas ci yang med do snyam pa ni ci yang med pa'i skyed mched do //
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa'i 'du shes dag las yang dag par 'das nas ci yang med do snyam pa ni ci yang med pa'i skyed mched do //
translated: Having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking there is nothing whatsoever, one enters and abides in the sphere of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las kyang yang dag par 'das phra ba ni 'du shes med pa dang 'dra ba yang dag par spyod pa'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las kyang yang dag par 'das phra ba ni 'du shes med pa dang 'dra ba yang dag par spyod pa'i phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the summit of existence. It is so called because it is beyond the perception of the sphere of nothingness, and because it is the correct practice of the subtle perception that is similar to non-perception.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: These are the entrances to the meditations and formless states.

original: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag nyid de dag ni pha rol phyin pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin sogs zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag nyid de dag ni pha rol phyin pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: Generosity and so forth are the six perfections that were previously explained. They are the entrances to the perfections.

original: lam dang zhes bya ba la lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos te //
analyzed: lam dang zhes bya ba la lam ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi chos te //
translated: The path is the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de dag bsgom pa ni lam gyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bsgom pa ni lam gyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of those is the entrance to the path.

original: byams pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la tshad med pa'i sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la tshad med pa'i sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i phyir tshad med pa'o //
translated: Love and so forth are the immeasurables. They are called immeasurables because they focus on all sentient beings, who are immeasurable.

original: de la rnam pa bzhi ste //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bzhi ste //
translated: There are four of them.

original: byams pa dang // snying rje dang // dga' ba dang // btang snyoms dang / de dag gi go rims bzhin du bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa dang // sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa dang // bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang //
analyzed: byams pa dang // snying rje dang // dga' ba dang // btang snyoms dang / de dag gi go rims bzhin du bde ba dang ldan par 'dod pa dang // sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa dang // bde ba dang mi 'bral bar 'dod pa dang //
translated: They are the wish for the happiness of those who are suffering, the wish for the separation from suffering of those who are happy, the wish for the non-separation from happiness of those who are happy,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'dod pa'o //
translated: and the wish for the non-production of suffering in those who are neither suffering nor happy.üîΩThe practice of the immeasurables is the practice of the four immeasurables: May all beings be endowed with happiness! May they be separated from suffering! May they not be separated from happiness!

original: kye ma sems can thams cad ni bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig snyam pa dang // sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa dang // bde ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig snyam pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa'o //üîΩde lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag ni tshad med pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma sems can thams cad ni bde ba dang ldan par gyur cig snyam pa dang // sdug bsngal dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa dang // bde ba dang mi 'bral bar gyur cig snyam pa dang // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur cig snyam pa'o // de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin te de dag ni tshad med pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: and May they remain in a state free from suffering and happiness!

original: stong nyid nyi shus chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa ni mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid nyi shus chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom pa ni mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: The practice of the applications of mindfulness is the practice of the four applications of mindfulness: the application of mindfulness to the body, the application of mindfulness to feelings, the application of mindfulness to mind, and the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sbyin par bya ba dang // sbyin pa po dang // len pa po mi dmigs pa nas //üîΩshes rabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' dang yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i bar de ni 'khor gsum yongs @36a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni sbyin par bya ba dang // sbyin pa po dang // len pa po mi dmigs pa nas // shes rabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' dang yid la byed pa mi dmigs pa'i bar de ni 'khor gsum yongs @36a * //
translated: The practice of the perfection of generosity is the non-apprehension of the gift, the giver, and the receiver.üîΩThe practice of the perfection of wisdom is the non-apprehension of the bodhisattva and the mental activity.

original: su dag pa'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: su dag pa'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: This is the engagement of the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: sgom pa po 'am /
analyzed: sgom pa po 'am /
translated: There is no meditator,

original: bsgom par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba 'am /
translated: no meditation,

original: sgom pa gang yang med pa de ni sgom pa mi dmigs pa ste sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa gang yang med pa de ni sgom pa mi dmigs pa ste sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: and no meditator at all. This is the non-apprehension of meditation, the destruction of meditation.

original: de'i don dang de'i ched du gang dge ba'i chos thams cad bsgom pa de ni ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don dang de'i ched du gang dge ba'i chos thams cad bsgom pa de ni ched du bya ba'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement of the aim is the cultivation of all virtuous qualities for that purpose and that aim.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su 'gro zhing der sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / de dag la theg pa chen po'i chos nyan cing sems can rnams la yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ni mngon par shes pa drug gi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs su 'gro zhing der sangs rgyas rnams la mchod pa dang / de dag la theg pa chen po'i chos nyan cing sems can rnams la yongs su smin par byed pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba ni mngon par shes pa drug gi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The engagement of the six kinds of preternatural knowledge is to go to the various buddhafields by means of the six kinds of preternatural knowledge, to make offerings to the buddhas there, to listen to the teachings of the Great Vehicle, to bring sentient beings to full maturity, and to purify one's own buddhafield.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob cing 'khor lo bskor ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa ni rnam pa kun mkhyen pa'i 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob cing 'khor lo bskor ba dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bsngags pa ni rnam pa kun mkhyen pa'i 'jug pa ste /
translated: The engagement of the knowledge of all aspects is to attain the knowledge of all aspects, to turn the wheel of the Dharma, and to be praised by all the buddhas of the ten directions.

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa yang rdzogs so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa yang rdzogs so //
translated: This completes the explanation of the engagement.

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan bcos las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge, from the point of view of the attainment of the accumulations, says:

original: rtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug /
analyzed: rtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug /
translated: The six, the peak, generosity and so on,

original: zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // sems pa dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang // zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // sems pa dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //
translated: and the practice of the aggregate of antidotes,

original: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: rim pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: should be known as the sequence.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: tshogs rnams kyi mthar ji ltar srid pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa la so sor rtog pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi mthar ji ltar srid pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa la so sor rtog pa ni brtse ba la sogs pa'i tshogs so //
translated: At the end of the collections, the discernment of the reality of existence as it is is the collection of love, etc.

original: de la dmyal ba dang yi dags dang / dud 'gror skyes pa dag la sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas rnams la dad pa dang / lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'dod pa ni skye ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de la dmyal ba dang yi dags dang / dud 'gror skyes pa dag la sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba dang / sangs rgyas rnams la dad pa dang / lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'dod pa ni skye ba'i tshogs so //
translated: Among them, the pacification of all suffering for those born as hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals, faith in the Buddhas, and the desire to be born as gods and humans is the collection of birth.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs drug gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs drug gi pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de dag nyid do //
translated: The six perfections are the six collections of generosity, etc.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gsum pa ni go cha'i sgrub pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang zung du 'brel ba'i tshogs gsum pa ni go cha'i sgrub pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The third collection, which is the union of serenity and insight, is like the armor practice.

original: gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa dag la spyod pa gzhan dag la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gang yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa dag la spyod pa gzhan dag la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i tshogs so //
translated: The collection of skill in means is the practice of the perfections with attention directed to the knowledge of all modes, by way of nonapprehension.

original: gang stong pa nyid nyi shu dag yongs su shes pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid nyi shu dag yongs su shes pa de ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The collection of knowledge is the thorough knowledge of the twenty kinds of emptiness.

original: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo dag las rgya cher gsungs te //
analyzed: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das yum chen mo dag las rgya cher gsungs te //
translated: These are taught extensively in the Mother Perfection of Wisdom sutras.

original: nang stong pa nyid @36b dang ; phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid @36b dang ; phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: They are: the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the inner and outer, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness, the ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of the unconditioned, the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the emptiness of what is without beginning or end, the emptiness of non-repudiation, the emptiness of intrinsic nature, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the emptiness of things, the emptiness of non-things, the emptiness of essential nature,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de /
translated: and the emptiness of other-nature.

original: 'di dag re re'i rigs pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag re re'i rigs pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reasoning for each of these is that they are not static and do not disintegrate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ji ltar rigs par rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid kyis stong pa nyid de rtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ji ltar rigs par rang gi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid kyis stong pa nyid de rtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are empty of just that intrinsic reality which is appropriate to them, since that is their permanent intrinsic reality.

original: rtag pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can ma yin te de dag gi rang bzhin ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag go //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ther zug tu gnas pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can ma yin te de dag gi rang bzhin ni rnam pa gnyis po de dag go //
translated: And the permanent is not something that endures eternally, nor is it something that is subject to destruction, since its nature is twofold.

original: de bas na de ni de'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de ni de'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, that is its emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni des de'i stong pa nyid de gang las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni des de'i stong pa nyid de gang las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is that? means from what does that emptiness of that arise?

original: 'di'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang las kyang mi skye ba zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang las kyang mi skye ba zhes ston to //
translated: As to ‚ÄúIts nature is not found in that,‚Äù etc., it shows that it does not arise from anything.

original: de la nang gi chos rnams ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la nang gi chos rnams ni mig la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: Therein, the internal phenomena are the six beginning with the eye.

original: de dag gis ni nang stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni nang stong pa nyid do //
translated: They are the emptiness of the internal.

original: phyi'i chos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa drug ste /
analyzed: phyi'i chos rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa drug ste /
translated: The external phenomena are the six beginning with form.

original: de de dag gis stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de de dag gis stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do ;
translated: They are the emptiness of the external.

original: / mig la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi stong pa nyid de //
analyzed: / mig la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag gi stong pa nyid de //
translated: The emptiness of the eye, etc. is the emptiness of form, etc.

original: de'i yul nyid kyi stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i yul nyid kyi stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is empty of the object of that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pas stong pa nyid de de'i yul can nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang mig la sogs pas stong pa nyid de de'i yul can nyid kyis stong pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The emptiness of form, etc. is the emptiness of the eye, etc. The meaning is that it is empty of the subject of that.

original: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid de de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid stong pa nyid de de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of all dharmas is itself emptiness. That is the emptiness of emptiness.

original: chen po stong pa nyid ni phyogs rnams kyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chen po stong pa nyid ni phyogs rnams kyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the great is the emptiness of the directions.

original: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste de des stong pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste de des stong pa ni don dam pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate is nirvana. Its emptiness of itself is the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te de dag gis stong pa ni 'dus @37a * //üîΩbyas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams te de dag gis stong pa ni 'dus @37a * //üîΩbyas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The compounded is the realms of desire, form, and the formless. Their emptiness is the emptiness of the compounded.

original: gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang // gnas pa med pa dang // mi 'gyur ba nyid de ni 'dus ma byas te de'i stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa dang // gnas pa med pa dang // mi 'gyur ba nyid de ni 'dus ma byas te de'i stong pa nyid ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is neither produced nor stopped, neither diminishes nor increases, neither comes nor goes, and is not made to be accepted or rejected, and is not made pure, is uncompounded.

original: gang gi mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste //
analyzed: gang gi mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste //
translated: The non-apprehension of its end is beyond the extremes.

original: de mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: That is emptiness of what is beyond extremes.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus kyi dngos po 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas thog ma dang bar dang tha ma yang med de //
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma med pa de la dbus kyi dngos po 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pas thog ma dang bar dang tha ma yang med de //
translated: That which has no beginning and end has no middle, because there is no coming or going of a middle entity.

original: dang po dang bar ma dang thams cad kyis stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po dang bar ma dang thams cad kyis stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: That which is empty of first, middle, and last is the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: gang la spangs pa de ni dor ba ste //
analyzed: gang la spangs pa de ni dor ba ste //
translated: That which is abandoned is rejected.

original: des stong pa ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid de //
analyzed: des stong pa ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid de //
translated: That which is empty of that is the emptiness of non-rejection.

original: gang la chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis nyan thos la sogs pas ma byas pas mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang la chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis nyan thos la sogs pas ma byas pas mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: That which is not made by nature by ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on is unchanging.

original: des stong pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des stong pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of that is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad chos thams cad kyis stong pa ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena with respect to all phenomena is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: gzugs so ring ba ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: gzugs so ring ba ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid do /
translated: The characteristic of form is that it is extended.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of feeling is experience.üîΩThe characteristic of perception is the apprehension of signs.üîΩThe characteristic of formation is that they form.

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes shes par bya ste //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o zhes shes par bya ste //
