original: chos de dag thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos de dag thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of those phenomena with respect to their own characteristics is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams phan tshun mi dmigs pa yin te thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ni 'das pa dang ma 'ong pa dang da ltar byung ba rnams phan tshun mi dmigs pa yin te thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of non-apprehension is the non-apprehension of past, future, and present phenomena with respect to each other, because they are pure from the beginning.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par byung pa de ni sngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te de ltar na yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par byung pa de ni sngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te de ltar na yang dag par sbyor ba las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin te //
translated: That which is dependently arisen has the nature of being non-empty, and so the nature of things that arise in dependence is not existent.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas yang dag par sbyor bas stong pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid yin pas yang dag par sbyor bas stong pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are dependently arisen, the emptiness of things that arise in dependence through connection is the emptiness of the nature of non-existence.

original: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste des stong pa ni dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ste des stong pa ni dngos po nyid do //
translated: Things are the five appropriated aggregates, and the emptiness of them is the emptiness of things.

original: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te de stong pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni 'dus ma byas te de stong pa ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Non-things are the unconditioned, and the emptiness of them is the emptiness of non-things.

original: rang gi ngo bo yin pas na rang gi ngo bo ste des stong pa ni rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yin pas na rang gi ngo bo ste des stong pa ni rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is one‚Äôs own nature, it is one‚Äôs own nature, and the emptiness of it is the emptiness of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni chos nyid de chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni chos nyid de chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The nature of others is the dharmatƒÅ, the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: des stong pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des stong pa ni gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of it is the emptiness of the nature of others.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang rin chen phyag rgya dang seng ge rnam par rol ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba dang rin chen phyag rgya dang seng ge rnam par rol ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs so //
translated: The concentrations called Heroic Valor, Jewel Seal, and Lion‚Äôs Play are the accumulations of meditative absorption.

original: lam gyi tshogs ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnam pa mang po yin pas de bshad par @37b bya'o //
analyzed: lam gyi tshogs ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnam pa mang po yin pas de bshad par @37b bya'o //
translated: The accumulations of the path are the many aspects of the factors of awakening.

original: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang // yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang // dbang po lnga dang // stobs lnga dang // byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang // 'phag pa'i lan yan lag brgyad de de ni byang chub kyi chis rnams so //
analyzed: de yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang // yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang // dbang po lnga dang // stobs lnga dang // byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang // 'phag pa'i lan yan lag brgyad de de ni byang chub kyi chis rnams so //
translated: They are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, and the eightfold noble path.

original: de la gang gi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar gnas pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi rjes su lta bas dran pa nye bar gnas pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: Among them, the establishment of mindfulness that is the observation of the body is the establishment of mindfulness that is the observation of the body.

original: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis ni bzhi ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i bye brag gis ni bzhi ste //
translated: It is fourfold due to the distinctions of object.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // chos drang pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang // chos drang pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: and the application of mindfulness to dharmas.

original: de la nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang ; / lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par yang mi byed de de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de la nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa dang ; / lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par yang mi byed de de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Here, one who is observing the internal body and is abiding in the observation of the body, and who is not conceptualizing through conceptualizing the body, is also steadfast, with introspection and mindfulness, by way of not apprehending anything.üîΩIn the same way, one who is observing the external body,üîΩin the same way, one who is observing the internal and external body,

original: de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang // de bzhin du nang phyi'i lus dang // de bzhin du nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang ; / chos dang tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba nas //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi'i lus dang // de bzhin du nang phyi'i lus dang // de bzhin du nang dang phyi dang phyi nang gi tshor ba dang sems dang ; / chos dang tshor ba'i rjes su lta ba nas //
translated: in the same way, one who is observing internal and external feelings, thoughts,üîΩand dharmas, up to

original: chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste //
translated: one who is observing dharmas and is abiding in the observation of dharmas,

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pas rnam par rtog par yang mi byed la //
translated: and who is not conceptualizing through conceptualizing dharmas,üîΩand who is not apprehending anything,

original: de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la phan pa'i sems dang // yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas so //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la phan pa'i sems dang // yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas so //

original: 'dir nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dir nang gi lus ni rang gi mig la sogs pa drug go //

analyzed: phyi rol gyi lus ni rang gi lus las phyi rol gyi 'dus byas so //
translated: The external body refers to the conditioned entities that are external to one‚Äôs own body.

original: phyi nang gi lus ni lhag ma 'byung pa dang 'byung ba las gyur ba rang gi lus su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gi lus ni lhag ma 'byung pa dang 'byung ba las gyur ba rang gi lus su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The internal-external body refers to the remaining elements and entities derived from the elements that are included within one‚Äôs own continuum.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang lus la dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang lus la dmigs pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum ste //
translated: The internal feelings, etc., are also threefold, according to whether they are related to the internal body, etc.

original: tshor ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa'o //

original: chos ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos ni sems las byung ba dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Mental formations are virtuous and nonvirtuous entities that are mental.üîΩThe internal-external mental formations are those that are related to the internal-external body.

original: lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba ni lus la sogs pa'o chos nyid la rjes su lta ba'o /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba ni lus la sogs pa'o chos nyid la rjes su lta ba'o /

original: lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni lus la sogs pa'i ming dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni lus la sogs pa'i ming dang ldan pa'o //

original: 'di ni bdag gi lus te bdag gi lus la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog pa'o //üîΩde la yang mi dmigs pa'i tshus kyis rjes su lta ba ni @38a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi lus te bdag gi lus la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog pa'o // de la yang mi dmigs pa'i tshus kyis rjes su lta ba ni @38a * //
translated: This is the conception of the body, etc. as ‚Äúmine,‚Äù as ‚ÄúI,‚Äù as ‚Äúmy self,‚Äù as ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù as ‚Äúimpermanent,‚Äù as ‚Äúhappy,‚Äù as ‚Äúsuffering,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: And the contemplation of that is non-discrimination, by way of non-apprehension.

original: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba yin pas na brtun pa'o //
analyzed: gus par byed pa dang rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor ba yin pas na brtun pa'o //
translated: It is ‚Äúdiligence‚Äù because it is the application of respect and constancy.

analyzed: rjes su lta ba dang shes bzhin gyi sbyor bas na shes bzhin no //
translated: It is ‚Äúawareness‚Äù because it is the application of contemplation and knowledge.

original: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang // rgyun tu srung bar byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar /
analyzed: mi brjed pa'i bdag nyid dang // rgyun tu srung bar byed pa'i bdag nyid dang // phyi rol du mi g-yeng bar /
translated: It is mindfulness, which has the nature of non-forgetting, the nature of constant protection, and the nature of non-distraction from external objects.

analyzed: byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dran pa ldan pa'o //

original: 'di dag btson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa yin te //
analyzed: 'di dag btson 'grus dang shes rab dang dran pa yin te //

original: 'du dag gi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'jug rten la brnab sems dang // yid mi bde ba bsal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du dag gi phan yon bstan pa'i phyir 'jug rten la brnab sems dang // yid mi bde ba bsal te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefit of the purification of the two obscurations, he says: ‚Äúhaving removed covetousness and mental dissatisfaction in regard to the objective supports of application.‚Äù
